Reason: The _transientMode configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly determines whether a TransientJournal or a PersistentJournal is used in the journal() method. This choice of journal type can have significant performance implications at the system level, as TransientJournal and PersistentJournal have different performance characteristics. The configuration-related code snippet that creates either journal type is time-expensive and memory-expensive, leading to notable performance variations in the system.
